conclusion: Determine the distance traveled by the car within 60 seconds based on the acceleration-time graph.
The graph shows three intervals of constant acceleration: 0-10s at +2 m/s², 10-40s at 0 m/s², 40-60s at -1 m/s².
Initial velocity v0 = 0 m/s since the car starts from rest.
Calculate velocity at t = 10s: v10 = 20 m/s using v = v0 + at.
Velocity remains constant at v40 = 20 m/s from t = 10 to t = 40s.
Calculate velocity at t = 60s: v60 = 0 m/s using v = v40 + at.
Calculate distance for interval 1 (0-10s): s1 = 100 m using s = v0t + 1/2at².
Calculate distance for interval 2 (10-40s): s2 = 600 m using s = vt.
Calculate distance for interval 3 (40-60s): s3 = 200 m using s = vt + 1/2at².
